DataElement.preferredName: Alcohol Past Year Average How Often Consumption Alcohol Consumption Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value that represents, in the past 12 months on average, how often a person drank any type of alcoholic beverage.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Alcohol Past Year Average How Often Consumption
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins.:A period of time consisting of the 12 months before the present._A statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers; used to interpret quantitative data._A question about the frequency of an event or behavior._The bodily process of taking in and using up something, especially the eating or drinking of something.

Concepts.definition: A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins.

Property.preferredName: Past Year Average How Often Consumption
Property.preferredDefinition: A period of time consisting of the 12 months before the present._A statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers; used to interpret quantitative data._A question about the frequency of an event or behavior._The bodily process of taking in and using up something, especially the eating or drinking of something.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 12 months before the present.
A statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers; used to interpret quantitative data.
A question about the frequency of an event or behavior.
The bodily process of taking in and using up something, especially the eating or drinking of something.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 2023.7.7 Updated def for 'No Value Exists'. ak

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The average number of alcoholic drinks consumed by the participant.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Observations and activities relating to behavior, such as smoking and ETOH use.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A symbol or string of symbols expressing value, quantity, or identification. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ReferenceDocuments.name: In the past 12 months, on ave
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the past 12 months, on average, how often did you drink any type of alcoholic beverage?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the past 12 months, on average, how often did you drink any type of alcoholic beverage?   (Enter number of days you drank based on the timeframe checked below.  Enter 0 if you never drank and skip to Question 6.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: Enter a whole number (i.e. "4") only. Do not enter a range or fraction.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-Text-2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Enter the number of days you drank based on the timeframe checked.  (Enter 0 if you never drank and skip to Question 6.)
